Package ygraph.ai.smartfox.games

Class GamePlayer

java.lang.Object
ygraph.ai.smartfox.games.GamePlayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
Amazon, COSC322Test, HumanPlayer, Spectator
public abstract class GamePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
A GamePlayer shall implements methods that handle game-specific message. A GameClient delegates all the game-specific message to a GamePlayer. See GameClient.java and GameMessage.java
Author:
Yong Gao (yong.gao@ubc.ca) Dec 12, 2020

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    abstract void connect()
    create a game client and use "this" class (a GamePlayer) as the delegate.

    abstract BaseGameGUI getGameGUI()

    This method starts the game GUI (if there is one attached to the player) and then call the method connect() to connect to the game server.

    Error, player timeout, and other system messages will be relayed here If you don't care about the message type, do what you want in the method handleMessage(String msg)

    Subclass of the GamePlayer shall decide the type of the gameGUI and cast it according When overriding this method, call super.postSetup() before doing anything else

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePlayer

      public GamePlayer()

  • Method Details

    • onLogin

      public abstract void onLogin()
      The method will be invoked by GameClient once the player has successfully logged onto the server. In this method, we usually find a room and join it.

    • handleGameMessage

      public abstract boolean handleGameMessage​(java.lang.String messageType, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> msgDetails)
      Call-back method upon receiving a message from the server
      Parameters:
      messageType - --- message type
      msgDetails - --- message details
      Returns:
      true unless something is wrong

      This method is called back by a GameClient whenever there is a game-related message from the server. For the COSC322 class, there are three types of messages as defined by the Strings: GameMessage.GAME_STATE_BOARD, GameMessage.GAME_ACTION_START, and GameMessage.GAME_ACTION_MOVE. The details of a message are included in the second argument "msgDetails" - a HashMap. The content of msgDetails for two types of messages is as follows.

      Type: GameMessage.GAME_STATE_BOARD
      Hash Key Object
      AmazonsGameMessage.GAME_STATE An ArrayList <Integer> encoding the game board
      Type: GameMessage.GAME_ACTION_START
      Hash Key Object
      AmazonsGameMessage.GAME_STATE An ArrayList <Integer> encoding the game board
      AmazonsGameMessage.PLAYER_BLACK A String for the user name of the player assigned to play the Black stone
      AmazonsGameMessage.PLAYER_WHITE A String for the user name of the player assigned to play the White stone
      Type: GameMessage.GAME_ACTION_MOVE
      Hash Key Object
      AmazonsGameMessage.QUEEN_POS_CURR An ArrayList <Integer> of size 2, for the current position (row, column) of the queen to be moved
      AmazonsGameMessage.QUEEN_POS_NEXT An ArrayList <Integer> of size 2, for the new position (row, column) for the queen to move to.
      AmazonsGameMessage.ARROW_POS An ArrayList <Integer> of size 2, for the position (row, column) of the arrow

    • handleMessage

      public boolean handleMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
      Error or timeout messages go here
      Parameters:
      msg - - the text msg
      Returns:
      true - if the message can be handled properly

    • handleMessage

      public boolean handleMessage​(java.lang.String msgType, java.lang.String msg)
      Error, player timeout, and other system messages will be relayed here If you don't care about the message type, do what you want in the method handleMessage(String msg)
      Parameters:
      msgType - The type of the message
      msg - the the message
      Returns:
      always returns true

    • postSetup

      public void postSetup()
      Subclass of the GamePlayer shall decide the type of the gameGUI and cast it according When overriding this method, call super.postSetup() before doing anything else

    • Go

      public void Go()
      This method starts the game GUI (if there is one attached to the player) and then call the method connect() to connect to the game server.

    • getGameClient

      public abstract GameClient getGameClient()
      Returns:
      the GameClient registered with this player

    • getGameGUI

      public abstract BaseGameGUI getGameGUI()
      Returns:
      the GameGUI attached to the player

    • connect

      public abstract void connect()
      create a game client and use "this" class (a GamePlayer) as the delegate. The game client will take care of the communication with the server. See GameClient.java

    • userName

      public abstract java.lang.String userName()
      Returns:
      the user name that you have used to login onto the server
